# Medial Motor Systems

Medial motor systems refer to the 4 descending spinal tracts:

- [Medial Corticospinal tract]({{< var ref-medial-corticospinal-tract.path >}}) @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022
- [Vestibulospinal tracts (VSTs)]({{< var ref-vestibulospinal-tract.path >}}) @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022
    - [Medial VST]({{< var ref-vestibulospinal-tract.medial >}}) @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022
    - [Lateral VST]({{< var ref-vestibulospinal-tract.lateral >}})  @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022
- [Reticulospinal tracts]({{< var ref-reticulospinal-tract.path >}})  @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022
- [Tectospinal tracts]({{< var ref-tectospinal-tract.path >}}) @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022

:::{.callout-note}
All of these tracts besides Medial Corticospinal tract are [extrapyramidal tracts]({{< var ref-extrapyramidal-tracts.path >}})
:::

![Somatotopic organization of medial and lateral motor system Projections to Anterior Horn Cells @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022](/The Archive/Neuroscience/Neuroanatomy/Tracts/images/fig.6.7 Blumenfeld somatotopic organization of medial and lateral motor systems.png)

# Pathway

The medial motor systems descend ipsilaterally or bilaterally.


Some extend only to the upper few cervical segments (see Table 6.3; Figure 6.11Câ€“E).
The number of segments each extend vary:

- The [Lateral VST]({{< var ref-vestibulospinal-tract.lateral >}}) extends the entire cord @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022
- The [Reticulospinal tracts]({{< var ref-reticulospinal-tract.path >}}) extends the entire cord @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022
- The [Medial Corticospinal tract]({{< var ref-medial-corticospinal-tract.path >}}) extends to the cervical and upper thoracic cord @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022
- The [Medial VST]({{< var ref-vestibulospinal-tract.medial >}}) extends to the cervical and upper thoracic cord @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022
- The [Tectospinal tracts]({{< var ref-tectospinal-tract.path >}}) only extends to the cervical cord @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022


# Function

The medial motor systems send motor efferent to the proximal axial and girdle muscles which allow for:

- Postural tone @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022
- Balance  @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022
- Orienting movements of the head and neck @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022
- Automatic gait-related movements  @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022
